      Decorator that adds two fields to an element that's been added to the view.
      class  ImageButton
      A button which is represented only by an image, with no label.
      class  Interface
      An Interface is an element which contains child elements and behaves just like a Container, except that it will actually draw all of the child elements as-is.
      class  PasswordField
      A text field where rather than showing the actual text in the field, asterisks are used instead.
      class  PriorityContainer
      This abstract class is an element which contains other elements.
      class  RadioButton
      A radio button is the circular counterpart to a checkbox.
      class  ReferenceText
      For when some text element will need to be updated, but there is no convenient event to base the text update on.
      class  ScrollView
      A ScrollView is an element which contains a single other element.

      The scroll bar that the ScrollView uses.
      class  SelectableButton
      A base class for selectable buttons, such as checkboxes and radio buttons.

      A Sprite is an image being shown in the game.

      Element FramedElement.topElementAtPoint(java.awt.Point point)
      Behaves like the super class in that if the top element is the wrapped element, it will be treated as 'this' However this element will also be the top at the point if the point is over the frame border anywhere
      Element AbstractDecoratorElement.topElementAtPoint(java.awt.Point point)
      The element is still essentially the top.
